content: I think we can put some settings in the dialog like this: pasted image

Examplescenario renderer is for locally previewing a diagram - really handy
pandoc.exe is used to convert doc/rtf to xhtml

but I don't know if the settings form is / should be used,
or if we should just ask users to edit a .ini file on notepad (so that we do not have to maintain yet another form)
do we need an external markdown editor?
we could launch it, just pointing to the file..
for me, for example, it's just a way to run typora (or other) to edit a page.
what does it do? 2 way editing? we have a markdown editor and a markdown processor....
hmmmm.. so as we edit an IG, we can add a file by pointing to a file (.md). The idea was just to "launch this file on the external editor", that simple. Just to allow people to do their wysiwyg.
the IG editor is not editing the content of the pages, just composing the page structure. So this external editor is just a way to look at the pages and edit as needed.
ah I thought you were talking about elements that were markdown
